channel.description: Just some things that come to my mind

item.title: 10 useful apps from the Salesforce AppExchange
item.description:
The Salesforce AppExchange is a marketplace that offers a wide variety of apps and integrations that can be used with the Salesforce platform. These apps can help businesses improve their operations and productivity by providing additional functionality and capabilities. Here are ten of the best apps from the Salesforce AppExchange.

  1. Conga Composer - Conga Composer is an app that allows users to create and send professional-grade documents directly from Salesforce. This app is ideal for businesses that need to generate contracts, quotes, or other documents on a regular basis.
  2. DocuSign - DocuSign is an app that provides electronic signature capabilities for Salesforce users. This app makes it easy for businesses to securely sign and manage documents directly from Salesforce, saving time and reducing the need for paper-based processes.
  3. *HubSpot - HubSpot is an app that integrates Salesforce with the popular marketing automation platform of the same name. This app allows businesses to manage and track their marketing efforts directly from Salesforce, providing a seamless experience for sales and marketing teams.
  4. JotForm - JotForm is an app that allows users to create and manage online forms directly from Salesforce. This app is ideal for businesses that need to collect information from customers or clients, such as surveys or contact information.
  5. Lucidchart - Lucidchart is an app that provides a visual diagramming tool for Salesforce users. This app allows businesses to create flowcharts, network diagrams, and other visualizations directly from Salesforce, making it easy to communicate complex ideas and processes.
  6. Mailchimp - Mailchimp is an app that integrates Salesforce with the popular email marketing platform of the same name. This app allows businesses to manage and track their email marketing campaigns directly from Salesforce, providing a seamless experience for sales and marketing teams.
  7. Quip - Quip is an app that provides a collaboration and document management tool for Salesforce users. This app allows teams to collaborate on documents, spreadsheets, and other files directly from Salesforce, making it easy to share and manage information.
  8. Tableau - Tableau is an app that provides data visualization and analysis capabilities for Salesforce users. This app allows businesses to create interactive dashboards and reports directly from Salesforce, making it easy to gain insights and make data-driven decisions.
  9. Workfront - Workfront is an app that provides project and task management capabilities for Salesforce users. This app allows businesses to manage and track their projects and tasks directly from Salesforce, providing a seamless experience for teams.
  10. Overcast – Overcast is an integration app from Vigience that allows to integrate any backend system into Salesforce. It comes with more than 150 predefined, ready-to-use applications that cover the most common business cases for the integration of SAP, Microsoft Dynamics and Oracle NetSuite.

Overall, the Salesforce AppExchange offers a wide variety of apps that can help businesses improve their operations and productivity. These ten apps are some of the best available on the AppExchange and are well worth considering for businesses that use Salesforce.

Text generated with OpenAI (with minor adjustments), images done with Stable Diffusion

item.title: Recipe for Spaghetti Carbonara
item.description:
Hey, wanna know how to make some spaghetti carbonara? It’s super easy, and you don’t even have to care about anything to make it. Here’s how to do it …

  1. Start by boiling a pot of water and cooking some spaghetti according to the package instructions. Don’t worry about measuring out the right amount or using good quality pasta - just toss in a handful of whatever you have lying around and let it cook until it’s mushy and overcooked.
  2. While the pasta is cooking, heat up a frying pan and add some bacon (or whatever meat you have on hand). Cook it until it’s crispy and burnt, because who cares about flavor or texture?
  3. In a separate bowl, crack a few eggs and whisk them together with some Parmesan cheese and black pepper. Don’t worry about using the right ratio of ingredients or mixing them well - just dump everything in and give it a quick stir.
  4. When the pasta is done, drain it and toss it into the frying pan with the bacon. Then, pour the egg and cheese mixture over the top and stir it all together until it’s coated in a gooey, greasy mess.
  5. Serve the spaghetti carbonara on a plate and top it with some more Parmesan cheese and black pepper, because who cares about presentation or taste?

And that’s it! You’ve just made a delicious (or not) meal of spaghetti carbonara without caring about anything. Enjoy!

Text generated with OpenAI (with minor adjustments), images done with Stable Diffusion

item.title: Salesforce Sales Cloud explained to 6-year-old children
item.description:
Hi kids, my name is Alex, and today I’m going to tell you about a really cool tool called Salesforce Sales Cloud.

Do you ever have trouble keeping track of all the things you need to do? Like remembering to do your homework, or feed your pet, or clean your room? Well, Salesforce Sales Cloud can help with that!

Salesforce Sales Cloud is a tool that helps grown-ups keep track of all the things they need to do in their jobs. It can help them keep track of who they need to talk to, what they need to do, and when they need to do it. And it can do all of this in one place, so they don’t have to worry about losing important information.

But that’s not all. Salesforce Sales Cloud can also help grown-ups collaborate with each other. This means that they can work together and share information, even if they’re not in the same place. This can help them get their work done even faster, and make sure that everyone is on the same page.

So as you can see, Salesforce Sales Cloud is a really powerful tool that can help grown-ups stay organized and work together. And who knows, maybe one day you’ll use it in your own job!

item.title: Migrate from SAP CRM on premise to Salesforce
item.description:
Migrating from SAP CRM on premise to Salesforce can provide numerous benefits for businesses, including better usability and less system maintenance. However, the migration process can be complex and it’s important to carefully plan and execute it in order to ensure a successful outcome.

One of the key considerations when migrating from SAP CRM on premise to Salesforce is the state of your current data. Before starting the migration process, it’s important to review and assess the data in SAP CRM to ensure that it is accurate and complete. This will help prevent any issues during the migration and ensure that your data is properly migrated to Salesforce.

Another important factor to consider is the type of data that will be migrated. Salesforce and SAP CRM have different data structures and capabilities, so it’s important to carefully plan how the data will be migrated from one system to the other. This may involve mapping the data fields between the two systems and potentially making some adjustments to ensure that the data is properly migrated.

In addition to the data itself, it’s also important to consider the various processes and workflows that are currently in place in SAP CRM. These will need to be migrated to Salesforce, so it’s important to carefully plan how this will be done in order to avoid any disruptions to your business operations.

Once the migration plan is in place, it’s important to thoroughly test the migration process to ensure that it is functioning as expected and that the data is being migrated properly. This is also a good time to provide training to your team on how to use Salesforce, as the migration will likely involve changes to their workflow and processes.

After the migration is complete, it’s important to closely monitor the new Salesforce system to ensure that it is functioning properly and providing the intended benefits to your business. This may involve making adjustments to the system and providing ongoing support and maintenance to ensure that it continues to meet your business needs.

Overall, migrating from SAP CRM on premise to Salesforce can be a complex process, but with careful planning and execution, it can provide numerous benefits for businesses. It’s important to carefully consider the various factors involved in the migration in order to ensure a successful outcome.

Horgen, Switzerland
Finally, after all this time, I catched Corona. So far I am feeling sick, but not too bad. I guess the three vaccine shots are helping.

item.title: Augsburg bus drivers are maniacs
item.description:
I can’t say it any other way - a lot of bus drivers in Augsburg should not be allowed to do their job.



When I see a red traffic light from afar, I take my foot of the gas paddle, but not so the AVV bus drivers. Sometimes they even accelerate and then break in the last second like a maniac. There are drivers who scratch the tires of the bus on every bus stop at the curb.

I am really surprised that there are not fatal accidents on a daily bases.

1922 - 2022


Hedwig Streibelt

item.title: Mental Employee Health Appreciation Day
item.description:
Some companies celebrate the 3rd March - Employee Appreciation Day.

Other companies have a Mental Health Day.

Where I work, at Vigience, we don’t have that. Here, employees are appreciated 365 days per year. Here, we take care of our mental health 12 months per year.

In such an environment, you don’t need some special day for marketing purposes.

item.title: Climate Change - Science Fiction vs. Reality
item.description:
I read The Ministry for the Future by Kim Stanley Robinson, a science fiction book set in the near future.



The book opens with a devastating heat wave in India and follows the path of mankind into the future and how it is able to prevent the worst. It is a book that can give hope.

Now today we have this:

The future is now and what has been science fiction yesterday, is reality today. The tweet sounds like Robinsons description in the book.
This picture was taken in the middle of the night in the absolut dark. My eyes could not see a thing. Looks like the iPhone camera can do magic (and it is only a iPhone 11).
